Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Codesane  (COD; XXA; natural AMPs; insects, arthropods, invertebrates, animals; BBMm)

Literature Information.Literature: APD analysis reveals that the sequence of this peptide shows 54.1% similarity toCaerin 1.6.  Molecular formula:   C90H161N23O20S1; Mol Wt 1917.469; GRAVY= 1.116; Wimley-White whole-residue hydrophobicity of the peptide:1.5  kcal/mol. Active against M. luteus (MIC 1.7 uM; B. subtilis (2.5 uM), S. aureus (3.7 uM), E. coli (3.7 uM), P. aeruginosa (31.7 uM), and C. albicans (MIC 25 uM). It is helical in the rpesence of SDS micelles or lipid vesicles. Hemolytic HL50 105 uM.
Literature Information.Author: ?ujová S, Bednárová L, Slaninová J, Straka J, ?e?ovský V. 2014
Literature Information.Title: Interaction of a novel antimicrobial peptide isolated from the venom of solitary bee Colletes daviesanus with phospholipid vesicles and Escherichia coli cells
